title: Picnic in the Park – High Tea and Garden ShowcaseTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Picnic in the Park – High Tea and Garden Showcase
One of Sydney’s biggest high teas will take place in the Macarthur region on Sunday, September 13, 2015, at Picnic in the Park, the first event of the annual Camden Festival.
Featuring delicious food, live music, children’s activities and a garden showcase, Picnic in the Park is one of the few major events in the Sydney region to be dedicated to the much-loved tradition of high tea.
Visitors can make their own high tea from a range of food stalls, with cupcakes, macaroons, cakes and slices, gozleme, wraps, sorbet, churros, mini donuts, Dutch pancakes, tea and coffee on offer. Camden Council will be handing out free native plants and a free jumping castle, face painting and animal farm will ensure children have plenty to keep them busy. Live acoustic entertainment, floral crown making and pot plant painting will also be on offer.
The event will be held at Macarthur Park in Camden, with the scenic surrounds of the park decorated by local business, Pretty Picnics. The event begins at 10am and concludes at 3pm.
Picnic in the Park is one of several events that form part of the popular Camden Festival along with a Kids’ Fun Day, a Cinema Under the Stars and the annual public opening of Camden Park House, the 1834 home of colonial pioneers John and Elizabeth Macarthur.
